title: Smart Information Literacy Education for Millennial Professional Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency and possession of job-related specialized knowledge
context.additional_context: A non-degree course for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to strengthen job competencies in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can identify work-related credible information with over 80% accuracy by applying a systematic framework for evaluating and selecting diverse information sources.
Learners understand information ethics principles in digital environments and can produce academic/professional outputs using plagiarism detection tools.
Learners can complete collaborative information-sharing projects with peer learners using mobile device-based collaboration tools.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
